Description: An ivory leg: in the form of a bull's leg, possibly from a game-board, with a tenon projecting 1.4cm from the top. This tenon is in the front left-hand corner of the upper surface, and is pierced by a single hole for fixing. In the left side of the leg is a small hole for a dowel. This leg belonged to the same object as 1899,0314.17, but was intended to be fixed on the opposite side, so that the positions of the tenon and dowel are reversed.
Curator's comments: For similar small ivory legs, see A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ II (Berlin, 1929-31) nos. 290-1.
Condition: Incomplete- legy only. The ivory is slightly split, but its general condition is good.
